captions.text: Meeting you has made everything new
The frustration lifted off my mind
My heart's hot because it's all so hot
Looking at you makes me burn
Hug me tight, wrap around my neck
When our eyes meet, let our lips do too
My eyes glued to the back of your neck
Time seems to have stopped, I want to keep hugging you
I've been waiting a long time for you
Our heartbeats gets me all pumped up
Look at me with warm eyes
I'm full of love for you
Even when we're apart, feels like we're together
We become one
Hug me tight, wrap around my neck
When our eyes meet, let our lips do too
My eyes glued to the back of your neck
Time seems to have stopped, I want to keep hugging you
Don't be nervous, trust me
When our eyes meet
Our heartbeats gets me all pumped up
No time to be bored with those shiny eyes
My heartbeat's like these beats
on the floor
Your face is like a masterpiece, I'm captivated
We take turns leading
allowing a little more each time
Break from the visual limitations
Tonight we just having fun
I don't want to hide my feelings
It's like the Eiffel Tower at 11:59
I'm all focused on you
Shaky eyes, your scent, small lips
Feel the spring air by the temperature of your words
I want the morning to come
I want to wake to your scent
Deeper into you, I want to see you
all day long with me
Time with you is sweeter than dreams

comments.author: ShiningKeep

comments.text:
Usually I hear songs like this when I listen to KBLX. It's all slow jamish 
and soulful. It has that nice smooth and sexy sound to it. Like Keith Sweat 
"Make it Last forever", John Legend "Green Light", Jill Scott "A Long 
Walk", Babyface "Every Time I Close My Eyes", etc. And I have noticed a lot 
of the artists...all of the artists I listed are of African-descent 
(Black). Sorry, I just picked songs that have come from my childhood. ^.^' 
My relative's house would be filled with music like this. Which is why I 
can still sing the old "One oh two point nine KBLX." tune. XD These days 
with the New KBLX they don't play that tune anymore but they do have Steve 
Harvey. 

Anyways...This song...I just want to DROWN it in awards! I hope it won 
awards, I didn't watch like any award shows this year. ﻿
